article.title: In Photos: Year in Review 2015-2016
article.description: Recapping the 2015-2016 school year through pictures from Daily Nexus photographers.
article.content:
Photos by Daily Nexus Photographers

With a new second-best NCAA record total of 14,919 fans in attendance, the second meeting of the season between UCSB and Cal Poly was the newest addition to a storied tradition. Dustin Harris / Daily Nexus
Snoop Dogg performs at the Thunderdome for Halloween Weekend. Lorenzo Basilio / Daily Nexus
As rain descends upon the campus of UC Santa Barbara, many students are ill-prepared to handle the conditions. The Nexus reccommends wearing proper footwear and leaving extra early for class, amongst other helpful tips. Lorenzo Basilio / Daily Nexus
More than 1,000 students march through campus demanding free tuition, the elimination of student debt and a $15 minimum wage during the Million Student March in November 2015. Lorenzo Basilio / Daily Nexus
Students and community members unite at vigil for Andres Esteban Sanchez. Stephen Manga/Daily Nexus
Nick DePuy traps the ball as he flys through the air. Cameryn Brock/Daily Nexus
Johnny Depp accepts the Maltin Modern Master Award for achievement in film. Lorenzo Basilio / Daily Nexus
Chancellor Yang cuts the ribbon at the ceremony held for opening of new library. Lorenzo Basilio / Daily Nexus
Students hang out in the new library. Eric Swenson / Daily Nexus
Jacob Delson swings over the block into the back corner of the court. Dustin Harris/Daily Nexus
Grouplove performs at the Warm Up. Lorenzo Basilio / Daily Nexus
Despite the lack of attendance at this year’s Deltopia, students still enjoyed the first weekend of spring quarter. Lorenzo Basilio / Daily Nexus
UCSB Professor of Art, Richard Ross, creates “Solitary” in the UCen to simulate the solitary confinement cells of American prisons. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
Walk the Moon performs at the Santa Barbara Bowl in May. Riley Esguerra / Daily Nexus
UCSB students Marshall Naito, Zoe Moriarty, and Madline Berger collect LED lights to disperse throughout the memorial of the second anniversary of the May 23 shooting.
The final day at SB hacks as people finish up their hacks and present to judges. John Clow / Daily Nexus
Students gather at the beach to celebrate Holi. Lorenzo Basilio / Daily Nexus
Campus United member Austin Hechler (center), and his supporters celebrate after Hechler bested two other candidates to become next year’s Associated Students President.
The crowd vibes to performers at Extravaganza. Stephen Manga / Daily Nexus
This season, the Gauchos took home their first Big West title in program history and won a bid to the NCAA tournament. Dustin Harris / Daily Nexus
Sanders condemns cost of higher education. Stephen Manga/Daily Nexus
Matt Healy of The 1975 entertains the crowd at the Santa Barbara Bowl in April. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
UCSB student Alagie Jammeh gains political asylum in the United States. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
Nexus File Photo
Print

related.title: In Photos: Extravaganza 2016 Lineup Reveal
related.description: Associated Students Program Board released the Extravaganza 2016 Lineup Thursday in the form of graffiti artists tagging a large, wooden board in Storke Plaza with the performers’ names. Photos...
related.content:
Associated Students Program Board released the Extravaganza 2016 Lineup Thursday in the form of graffiti artists tagging a large, wooden board in Storke Plaza with the performers’ names.

Photos by Jenny Luo, Francisco Barrera, Spencer Brandt and Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs.

Graffiti artists announce Emancipator as the first Extravaganza act. Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs / Daily Nexus
Spencer Brandt
Anderson .Paak and The Free Nationals are the second and third acts announced for Extravaganza 2016. Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs / Daily Nexus
Graffiti artists name acts for Extravaganza 2016. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
The final Extravaganza 2016 act, ODESZA, is announced. Francisco Barrera / Daily Nexus

related.title: In Photos: Lite the Nite Illuminates Isla Vista
related.description: More than 200 students and Isla Vistans filled People's Park in Isla Vista Saturday night, playing carnival games, winning prizes and listening to the electronic thumps of multiple DJs.
related.content:
Organizers estimated more than 2,000 students and Isla Vistans filled People’s Park in Isla Vista Saturday night, playing carnival games, winning prizes and listening to the electronic thumps of multiple DJs.

Blunite and UCSB Ambience hosted Lite the Nite for students and local residents to celebrate the lives of six UCSB students who were killed in Isla Vista by a Santa Barbara City College student on May 23, 2014.

The hundreds of lights in the park Saturday were meant to illuminate “the path between us in light of the darkness that fell over our community in 2014,” according to Blunite’s Facebook page. Read more about what the event means to the organizers here.

Photos by Spencer Brandt and Francisco Barrera.

Francisco Barrera / Daily Nexus

[Correction: A previous version of this article said the perpetrator in the May 2014 shooting was a UCSB student. He was a Santa Barbara City College student.]

related.title: In Photos: Extravaganza 2016
related.description: Thousands of students packed Harder Stadium at UCSB on Sunday for Extravaganza, UCSB's annual spring concert.
related.content:
Thousands of students packed Harder Stadium at UC Santa Barbara on Sunday for Extravaganza, UCSB’s annual spring concert presented by Associated Students Program Board.

Electronic duo ODESZA headlined the show, which also included rap duo Rae Sremmurd, Anderson .Paak, Zella Day and Emancipator.

Photos by Stephen Manga.

Anderson .Paak. Stephen Manga / Daily Nexus
Stephen Manga / Daily Nexus
Stephen Manga / Daily Nexus
Zella Day. Stephen Manga / Daily Nexus

[Correction: A previous version of this article implied that ODESZA and Rae Sremmurd co-headlined. ODESZA was the sole headlining act.]
